alert.note: Alert for Lagrange; Noble (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 5:32PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Noble and southeastern Lagrange Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 532 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rome City, or near Lagrange, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Noble and southeastern Lagrange Counties, including the following locations... Wolcottville, Elmira, Big Long Lake, Stroh, Eddy, Adams Lake, Indianola, Oliver Lake and Woodruff. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
